alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Pulaski (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 11:29AM CST until March 14 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...Missouri...Illinois... Ohio River at Cairo affecting Carlisle, Alexander, Mississippi, Pulaski, Fulton, Hickman and Ballard Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO TUESDAY, MARCH 14... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Cairo. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to Tuesday, March 14. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Saturday the stage was 37.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 46.0 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, March 14. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 45.7 feet on 02/13/1957. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
